message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Obliterating endarteritis of the vasa vasorum of the aorta is often associated with syphilis, so the most likely positive investigation would be Rapid plasma reagin (RPR) for syphilis. Increased dsDNA titer is seen in autoimmune diseases such as lupus. Increased ketonuria suggests diabetic ketoacidosis. Increased serum creatinine is seen in kidney disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Obliterating endarteritis is associated with syphilis, so the most likely investigation to be positive would be RPR (rapid plasma reagin), which is used to screen for syphilis. The other options are not associated with obliterating endarteritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Obliterating endarteritis of the vasa vasorum of the aorta is associated with syphilis. Rapid plasma reagin (RPR) is a screening blood test for syphilis and is the most likely to be positive in this patient. Increased dsDNA titer is associated with systemic lupus erythematosus, increased ketonuria is associated with diabetic ketoacidosis, and increased serum creatinine is associated with renal dysfunction.

Increased dsDNA titer is associated with autoimmune diseases such as lupus, not obliterating endarteritis. Ketonuria suggests diabetic ketoacidosis, and increased serum creatinine suggests renal dysfunction, neither of which are associated with obliterating endarteritis.
